doc:
Margaret Seddon https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margaret_Seddon 0 Margaret Rhea Seddon (born November 8, 1947) is a physician and retired NASA astronaut. After being selected as part of the first group of astronauts to include women, she flew on three Space Shuttle flights: as mission specialist for STS-51-D and STS-40, and as payload commander for STS-58. Both before and after her career in the astronaut program, she has been active in the medical community in Tennessee, Mississippi and Texas. Margaret_Rhea_Seddon ( born November_8_,_1947 ) is a_physician and retired NASA_astronaut . After being_selected as part of the_first_group of astronauts to_include women , she flew on three_Space_Shuttle_flights : as mission_specialist for STS-51-D_and_STS-40 , and as payload_commander for STS-58 . Both_before_and_after her_career in the_astronaut_program , she has_been active in the_medical_community in Tennessee_,_Mississippi_and_Texas .
